data.event: Settlement began at the location in 1876 and by 1890 a small town had developed.
Settlement began at the location in 1876 and by 1890 a small town had developed.
The town has a very rich German history, reflected today in the many Anglo-German road and street names as well as the many local German settler descendant surnames.

event.title: changed to Kalbar because of anti-German sentiment in 1916

data.event: The name changed to Kalbar because of anti-German sentiment in 1916.
Engelsburg Post Office opened on 7 July 1897 (a receiving office had been open from 1878. known as Engels for five years) and was renamed Kalbar in 1916.
Engelsburg Post Office opened on 7 July 1897 (a receiving office had been open from 1878. known as Engels for five years) and was renamed Kalbar in 1916.
Engelsburg Post Office opened on 7 July 1897 (a receiving office had been open from 1878. known as Engels for five years) and was renamed Kalbar in 1916.

event.title: 1920, the Kalbar School of Arts hall and half the businesses in town were destroyed

data.event: In 1920, the Kalbar School of Arts hall and half the businesses in town were destroyed by fire.
